page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERN IN CURDWORTH
page.content: A PROPOSED PLAN FOR A MOTORWAY SERVICE AREA WITH HUNDRED BED ACCOMMODATION. RESTAURANT, PICNIC AREA, LORRY, COACH AND CAR PARKS ON GREEN BELT BETWEEN THE M42 MOTORWAY AND ADJOINING CURDWORTH VILLAGE WAS MADE PUBLIC AT CHRISTMAS. DISBELIEF AND OUTRAGE PROMPTED A PETITION AND PROTEST LETTERS TO THE PLANNING OFFICE. OUR LOCAL M.P. ADVISED FORMING A RESIDENT ASSOCIATION AND A PUBLIC MEETING IN CURDWORTH VILLAGE HALL, 250 RESIDENTS ATTENDED AND VOICED FEARS OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS OF ATTACHING A SERVICE AREA TO A RESIDENTIAL ONE, WITH FUMES, NOISE, SECURITY AND DRAINAGE. LETTERS UNDERLINING THESE OBJECTIONS WERE SENT TO THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES SIX MONTHS LATER THE PLAN HAS STILL NOT COME BEFORE THE PLANNING COMMITTEE AND THREE ADJACENT HOUSES ARE FOR SALE.
